doc.title: Images
doc.excerpt: Handling local and remote images in Reflex.

data.title: Images
data.excerpt: Handling local and remote images in Reflex.
data.rawBody:
---
title: Images
excerpt: Handling local and remote images in Reflex.
---

## Local images

To use and reference images in your content, place your images in the `content/images` directory.

Then reference the image using its path.

```jsx
<Image src="name-of-image.png" alt="An image" />
```

The `Image` component is a wrapper around Gatsby Image. You can learn more about Gatsby image [here](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/packages/gatsby-image/).

## Remote images

Remote images can be used the same way.

```jsx
<Image src="https://example.com/image.png" alt="External image" />
```

<Callout level="secondary">

**Note**: Due to a [bug](https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/issues/19785) with gatsby-remark-images
and mdx, we are using a workaround for images. We'll fix this once the bug is resolved.

</Callout>

## Aspect ratio

The `Image` component has support for aspect ratio using the `aspectRatio` prop:

### 4/3

```jsx
<Image src="placeholder.jpg" aspectRatio={4 / 3} />
```

<Image src="placeholder.jpg" aspectRatio={4 / 3} maxW="50%" />

### 16/8

```jsx
<Image src="placeholder.jpg" aspectRatio={16 / 8} />
```

<Image src="placeholder.jpg" aspectRatio={16 / 8} maxW="50%" />
